Fire Section -Covers the loss or damage by insured perils to the whole or part of the property described. Fire section can be extended at an additional cost to include deterioration of stock up to 25% of the fridge and or freezer contents subject to the fridge and/or freezer being covered under the fire section. This is subject to a 48hrs time excess. Geyser can be included under this section. (Everything insured under the fire section is subject to the fire perils) Office Contents – Covers the loss or damage by insured perils to the office contents up to the sum insured. Theft is covered up to 25% of the sum insured maximum R25 000. Theft can be extended to 25% of the sum insured if it is more than R25 000 at an additional premium. Theft claims are subject to forcible an or violent entry or exit. This section excludes electronic processing equipment, any negotiable documents and money. (Consultant to determine whether contents fits Office Contents or Fire) Stock in trade, Business Contents i.e: furniture, equipment, shelving, fixtures and fittings, etc... amount probed and verified. Accidental breakage of mirror glass, plate glass tops to furniture or fixed glass forming part of any article of furniture.
Construction and Security of the Business Premises

Business Continuity (Business Interruption) -Loss or damage as a result of accident or misfortune (hereinafter termed Damage) to the insured’s books of account or other business books or records at the premises or at the residence of any director, partner or employee or the premises of any accountant of the insured, in consequence whereof the insured is unable to trace or establish the outstanding debit balances in whole or part due to them. The insurer will not pay for wear and tear or gradual deterioration or moths or vermin. Detention, seizure or confiscation by any lawfully constituted authority.

Documents -Loss of or damage to documents normally kept at the office premises; films, tapes, addressograph plates, books, records, maps, plans, drawings, abstracts, deeds, wills, mortgages, agreements, manuscripts, letters, certificates, documents and similar written, printed or otherwise inscribed papers and documents used by the insured in the business and owned by them

Accounts Receivable - Loss or damage as a result of accident or misfortune (hereinafter termed Damage) to the insured’s books of account or other business books or records at the premises or at the residence of any director, partner or employee or the premises of any accountant of the insured, in consequence whereof the insured is unable to trace or establish the outstanding debit balances in whole or part due to them. The insurer will not pay for wear and tear or gradual deterioration or moths or vermin. Detention, seizure or confiscation by any lawfully consistuted authority.

Theft  Theft covered on a first loss basis, limits to theft based on security requirements verify with the underwriters. Loss of or damage to all contents (the property of the insured or for which they are responsible) of any insured building, at the insured premises described in the schedule as a result of theft accompanied by forcible and violent entry into or exit from such building or any attempt thereat or as a result of theft, or any attempt thereat, following violence or threat of violence. Goods in the open are only covered if they are designed to exist and operate in the outside and the cover is extended by the underwriter – referral to the underwriter. Alarm warranty is applicable to the entire policy section that requires theft where advised.

Liabilities Cover (Public Liability, Employers Liability, Product Liability) -Probed clients risk requirements (Employers, PI, Products liability or Public liability). Employers Liability - Disclosed COIDA requirements legally liable to pay for death of or bodily injury to or illness of a person employed. Public Liability - Insured found legally liable to pay for death of or bodily injury to or illness or damage to 3rd party and or their property. Defective workmanship – This will cover resultant damage and is effective once the contract has been handed over. (Items being worked on that are damaged have no cover (custody and control)). Products liability –Covers the insured against legal liability for injury or damage caused by goods or products, sold or supplied by the insured in connection with the business. This excludes the cost of repairs, alterations, recall or replacement of the goods or product causing injury or damage.

Electronic Equipment Must probe; Description, Seriel Number, Sum Insured, Was consequential loss cover offered? Loss of or Physical damage to any Electronic Equipment (Data Processing) stated in the schedule. Alarm warranty may be applicable subject to underwriting. Loss of the property insured by theft during transit or whilst temporarily removed from the insured premises is not covered unless identifiable by the insured with the specific incident which has been reported to the Police and company. Disappearance is not covered however Car Jamming cover for Laptops only can be added under this section at an additional premium. Laptops are not covered on an all risk basis unless the clause has been added. (Please check if clause has been included). When in an unattended vehicle the laptop must be in a locked concealed compartment away from public view. Loss or damage by lightning or power surge will be subject to an additional 10% excess if there is no Lightning or power surge protectors/arrestors.
Accidental Damage - Accidental physical loss of or damage to the insured property in or on the business premises where accidental damage is not covered.

Adhering to laid down business process & rules as per product specifications:1.No 3rd party premium payers allowed. The Principal Life Assured must be the premium payer
2.Spouse Life Assured must be available to answer the medical disclosure questions via telephone – or spouse cover cannot be issued
3.Up to 5 beneficiaries are allowed per policy
4. The customer does not need to have a Standard Bank account in order to take out this product

5. The maximum Life Cover benefit per Life Assured across all Flexible Life Plan policies will further be limited to R500 000. Where the maximum benefit has been paid, no further benefits will be paid
6.Processed debit date from inception 3-5 working day

7.The spouse does not have to consent to POPI – as the policy is issued in the main insured’s name and by speaking to the spouse the spouse is being made aware that their spouse is taking out a policy for them.  Only the main insured can nominate beneficiaries, and the beneficiaries are sanction screened at claims stage. If the Spouse passes away – the benefit amount is paid to the main insured. The Spouses information if not processes or sanction screened on a daily basis.

The amount for which you insure your belongings must be the replacement value. The replacement value is what it will cost you at the time of a claim to replace items claimed for with new ones.Should you claim, insurers will calculate the replacement value you should have insured yourself for. If you insured it for less than the replacement value insurers only pay a portion of your claim. This is what we term "UNDER INSURANCE".

Adhering to laid down business process & rules as per product specifications:1.No 3rd party premium payers allowed. The Principal Life Assured must be the premium payer                                                                                                                  2.The Spouse Life Assured must be available to answer the medical disclosure questions via telephone – or spouse cover cannot be issued.                                                                                3.Up to 5 beneficiaries are allowed per policy                                                                                                                                                                                                                                4.The customer does not need to have a Standard Bank account in order to take out this product5.The maximum Life Cover benefit per Life Assured across all Flexible Life Plan policies will further be limited to R500 000. Where the maximum benefit has been paid, no further benefits will be paid 6.Processed debit date from inception 3-5 working day                                                                                                                                                                                                                    7.The spouse does not have to consent to POPI – as the policy is issued in the main insured’s name and by speaking to the spouse the spouse is being made aware that their spouse is taking out a policy for them.  Only the main insured can nominate beneficiaries, and the beneficiaries are sanction screened at claims stage. If the Spouse passes away – the benefit amount is paid to the main insured. The Spouses information if not processes or sanction screened on a daily basis.

When you miss a premium (for example your debit order came back as unpaid because of insufficient funds) we will notify you of such missed premium and you will have 15 days to pay this premium before we reduce your benefit amount.

The amount for which you insure your belongings must be the replacement value. The replacement value is what it will cost you at the time of a claim to replace items claimed for with new ones.Should you claim, insurers will calculate the replacement value you should have insured yourself for. If you insured it for less than the replacement value insurers only pay a portion of your claim. This is what we term "UNDER INSURANCE".
